intro: Hirtella suffulta, commonly known as the hairy hirtella, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hirtella suffulta is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
